title: 8 Interior Design Ideas to Update Your Kitchen (Goodbye, Open Shelving)
sub_head: Architects and other design pros share new kitchen trends that can help turn the heart of your home into a quietly cohesive space
body:
IF EVERYTHING wants to stand out, nothing will,” said Kelsey Hills, a Dallas homeowner who hired a local pro to quiet the center of her house, the kitchen. Architect and designer Eddie Maestri infused the room with white oak—on the floor, flat-front cabinets and island. “Having a kitchen without a lot of competing design elements calms me,” said Mrs. Hills.
Enter the era of seamless kitchens. “Visual cues are changing,” said Mr. Maestri. Gone are look-at-me hoods and, for some, hulking marble islands. Paneled cabinets bejeweled with pulls are giving way to overlay fronts and hidden hardware. The visual cacophony of open shelves is history.
